means: 切，削（木头），使逐渐变小( whittle的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: By September, they will have whittled the list down to a winner.
sentence.Network_cn: 9月之前他们会从名单中确定出最后的赢家。

sentence.Network_en: He had whittled eight interviewees down to two.
sentence.Network_cn: 他已经逐渐将参加面试的人数由8人减少到2人。

sentence.Network_en: He whittled a simple toy from the piece of wood.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把那块木头削成了一个简易的玩具。

PerfectNetExp.abs: We whittled a wooden horse ., 我们削成一匹木马.

list.abs: use their bills to whittle twigs ., 用它们的嘴去刻树枝.

use their bills to whittle twigs ., 用它们的嘴去刻树枝.

entry.def: If you whittle something from a piece of wood, you carve it by cutting pieces off the wood with a knife.

example.ex: He whittled a new handle for his ax...
example.tran: 他给斧头削了一个新把手。

example.ex: Chitty sat in his rocking-chair whittling wood.
example.tran: 奇蒂坐在摇椅上削着木头。

auth_sentence.content: He whittled away at a stick.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He whittled away at a stick.

auth_sentence.content: The years and various deals have whittled the ten down to four.
auth_sentence.res_content: The years and various deals have whittled the ten down to four.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The years and various deals have whittled the ten down to four.

auth_sentence.content: Over time, incorrect assumptions about the world are whittled away by trial and error.
auth_sentence.res_content: Over time, incorrect assumptions about the world are whittled away by trial and error.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Over time, incorrect assumptions about the world are whittled away by trial and error.
